Articles.Content:
Hey guys. I don\'t usually upload creations, but in this case I need help with something that\'s sort of beyond my ability.

Spec-1 is an orbiter designed to orbit basically anywhere but Kerbin (it can do that too, of course, but it would still have an extra stage attached). So far I\'ve had two successful trips to the Mun, with one going into an equatorial orbit, while the other did some maneuvers trying to establish a polar orbit before saying 'screw it' and returning, because I suck at changing orbital planes. More on that now.

I want to see if this thing can make it into orbit around Minmus, with enough fuel left over to safely return. Preferably, it would be able to change its plane while on Minmus, doing whatever maneuvers are needed, and return. Since I learned on the Mun that I\'m not good at plane changes and therefore can\'t establish an encounter, I\'d like it if someone with more experience could try it out.

LAUNCH PROCEDURE

Step 1: Throttle up, SAS on. Launch.

Step 2: Wait for SRBs to burn out, then stage. SRBs and radial tanks will fall.

Step 3: Simply wait for the main engine to run out of fuel. In tests thus far, has always gone between 72 and 73 kilometers.

Step 4: Stage, then immediately begin burning towards 90 until a PE of just above 70km is achieved.

Step 5: [Mun - wait for Munrise, then burn towards 90 until encounter is achieved.]

Step 5: [Minmus - Plane change maneuvers, I guess, maybe, then same procedure as Mun, but, uh, for Minmus encounter.]

Step 5b: It\'s likely your radial engines will run out of fuel while injecting. Pay close attention and jettison as early as possible.

Step 6: Standard orbiting procedure.

So not much, just want to see if it\'s capable of making it. It\'s still in the testing stages, but just be thankful you\'re not part of the early testing stages.
